result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracy Wayne Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-No controlled substance

-Urine screens
-Obtain GED

-Cognitive thinking intervention counselling
-Parenting classes/counselling
-Job and vocational training
Court sets -0- restitution......Should defendant successfully complete all conditions set forth by this Court, the Probation Department/Department of Corrections, pay all costs and surcharges and remain free and clear of the criminal justice system arising to the level of probable cause, the Court would consider petition for expungement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

State's Witness List received and filed with:
 - State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Tracy Wayne Smith not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties still negotiating.  Case remains on for trial.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Tracy Wayne Smith not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested one more final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.
/submitted by defendant, pro se, filed. rn
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  6/23/14.

Attorney Louis E. Epps in court, defendant Tracy Wayne Smith not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following schedule: movant has until 4/08/14 to file any motions; response due 4/23/14; reply due 4/28/14.  Court ordered all motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists filed with the court one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's pro se motion for speedy trial, received and filed.  Copies e-mailed to the State and defense counsel. rn

Attorney Louis E Epps in court appearing by telephone, defendant Tracy Wayne Smith not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Case is adjourned for scheduling before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Tracy Wayne Smith in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Tracy Wayne Smith in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Officer Erik Smith

Defendant Tracy Wayne Smith in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Tracy Wayne Smith in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
